verses.kjv: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring?
verses.ct: My God, my God, why have you abandoned me? Why are you so far from rescuing me, so far from my cries of anguish?

verses.kjv: O my God, I cry in the day time, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.
verses.ct: My God, I call out during the day, but you don't answer; I call out at night and find no rest.

verses.kjv: But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel.
verses.ct: Yet you are holy, enthroned on the praises of Israel.

verses.kjv: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.
verses.ct: Our ancestors put their trust in you — they trusted, and you rescued them.

verses.kjv: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.
verses.ct: They called out to you and were saved; they relied on you and were never put to shame.

verses.kjv: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.
verses.ct: But I am like a worm, not even human — mocked by everyone, looked down on by the people.

verses.kjv: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,
verses.ct: Everyone who sees me ridicules me; they sneer at me and shake their heads, saying,

verses.kjv: He trusted on the LORD that he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.
verses.ct: "He relied on the LORD — let the LORD rescue him! Let God save him, since God is so pleased with him!"

verses.kjv: But thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope when I was upon my mother’s breasts.
verses.ct: Yet you are the one who brought me safely from the womb; you gave me security at my mother's breast.

verses.kjv: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my God from my mother’s belly.
verses.ct: I was placed in your care from birth; you have been my God since my mother carried me.

verses.kjv: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.
verses.ct: Don't stay far from me, because trouble is close and there is no one else to help.

verses.kjv: Many bulls have compassed me: strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round.
verses.ct: Powerful enemies surround me; fierce ones like the strong bulls of Bashan close in on every side.

verses.kjv: They gaped upon me with their mouths, as a ravening and a roaring lion.
verses.ct: They open their mouths wide against me, like a tearing, roaring lion.

verses.kjv: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.
verses.ct: I am drained away like water, and all my bones are pulled apart. My heart has become like wax, melting inside me.

verses.kjv: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.
verses.ct: My strength is dried up like a broken piece of pottery; my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth. You have laid me down in the dust of death.

verses.kjv: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.
verses.ct: Enemies circle me like dogs; a mob of evil people has closed in around me. They have pierced my hands and my feet.

verses.kjv: I may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me.
verses.ct: I can count every one of my bones. They stand there staring at me, gloating.

verses.kjv: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.
verses.ct: They divide my clothing among themselves and throw dice for what I'm wearing.

verses.kjv: But be not thou far from me, O LORD: O my strength, haste thee to help me.
verses.ct: But you, LORD, don't stay far away! You are my strength — rush to help me!

verses.kjv: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.
verses.ct: Rescue my soul from the sword, my precious life from the power of these dogs.

verses.kjv: Save me from the lion’s mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.
verses.ct: Save me from the lion's jaws! You have answered me from the horns of the wild oxen.

verses.kjv: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.
verses.ct: I will proclaim your name to my brothers and sisters; right there in the assembly I will praise you.

verses.kjv: Ye that fear the LORD, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.
verses.ct: All of you who deeply revere the LORD, praise him! All you descendants of Jacob, honor him! Stand in awe of him, all you descendants of Israel!

verses.kjv: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.
verses.ct: For he has not ignored or turned away from the suffering of the afflicted one; he has not withdrawn his favor from him, but listened when he cried out.

verses.kjv: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.
verses.ct: Because of you, I will offer praise in the great assembly; I will fulfill my promises in front of those who deeply revere him.

verses.kjv: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the LORD that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.
verses.ct: The humble will eat and be satisfied; those who seek the LORD will praise him. May your hearts be filled with life forever!

verses.kjv: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the LORD: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.
verses.ct: Every corner of the earth will remember and turn back to the LORD, and all the families of every nation will worship in your presence.

verses.kjv: For the kingdom is the LORD’s: and he is the governor among the nations.
verses.ct: For the kingdom belongs to the LORD, and he rules over the nations.

verses.kjv: All they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.
verses.ct: All the prosperous of the earth will feast and worship; all who are returning to the dust will kneel before him — those who cannot preserve their own lives.

verses.kjv: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.
verses.ct: Future generations will serve him; the Lord will be talked about to the coming generation.

verses.kjv: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done this.
verses.ct: They will come and announce his righteousness to a people not yet born — that he has accomplished it.
